text:
Has anyone gotten spam PRs which mine crypto on CI?
I got one here: <https://github.com/ctp-fpub/LaTeXTemplates/pull/6>

What is the best way to deal with this?

elements.text:
Has anyone gotten spam PRs which mine crypto on CI?
I got one here:
What is the best way to deal with this?

text: Close the PR and report the user?

elements.text: Close the PR and report the user?

text:
Ok, thanks
I wasn't sure if there was anything I could do to prevent such things in the future

elements.text:
Ok, thanks
I wasn't sure if there was anything I could do to prevent such things in the future

text: To prevent I don't think so, users can do whatever they want in pull requests. It's unclear why they need to create pull requests for other projects instead of using their own account though

elements.text: To prevent I don't think so, users can do whatever they want in pull requests. It's unclear why they need to create pull requests for other projects instead of using their own account though

text: Especially since it won't work since IIUC new workflows don't even run when the PR is from  fork..

elements.text: Especially since it won't work since IIUC new workflows don't even run when the PR is from  fork..

text: For some reason it looks like it ran <https://github.com/ctp-fpub/LaTeXTemplates/runs/2254562124?check_suite_focus=true>

elements.text: For some reason it looks like it ran

text: or maybe the first action at all in a repository doesn't work if it's from a registry?  that's definitely something I've observed

elements.text: or maybe the first action at all in a repository doesn't work if it's from a registry?  that's definitely something I've observed

text: I think there are some options in the repo settings to set interaction limits for newly created accounts, which might help
